div.p: 3455 Table Mesa Dr. Apt i203 • Boulder, CO 80305
Software engineer seeking full-time employment in the western United States, or remote.

ul.li: I work on Anark Workstation, a desktop (.NET, WPF) application for viewing and manipulating CAD documents and publishing to PDF or to Anark Collaborate.

I'm currently helping on a project to replace our legacy OpenGL renderer with the WebGL renderer used by Anark Collaborate - using the Chromium Embedded Framework and CefSharp. My responsibilities on the project so far have been related to Javascript interop and improving performance.

I've also added small features and fixed bugs in our integration with Anark Collaborate, including changes to Anark Core XML (used to bind user defined attributes to CAD data), and improvements to the HTTP publishing in Anark Workstation.
I was responsible for largely rewriting our Catia importer using C++/CLI and the Spatial Interop library to get more accurate results with better performance.
I've also helped fix import bugs in the other CAD formats, including NX with NXOpen, Creo with ProToolkit, and other formats using Techsoft's HOOPS Exchange.
Worked on the Google Earth Enterprise Platform (GEEP), a collection of value added products and services based on the open source Google Earth Enterprise (OpenGEE) software.
Helped implement the Panoramic Management microservice and designed its functional test framework using Python, Flask, GDAL, and PostGIS.
Implemented and benchmarked a plugin for storing Google Earth data natively in S3 using the AWS C++ SDK, though it wasn't released.
Added support for triangulated irregular network (TIN) terrain data to the GEEP ATAK plugin using the Java-based ATAK plugin SDK, JNI, and C++.
Fixed bugs and worked on several small features using C++, Python, GDAL, QGis, and PostGIS.
Reviewed and tested pull requests from my coworkers and open source developers.
Assisted DevOps with our CI pipelines, using several AWS services (S3, EC2, CodeBuild, etc.), Gradle, Jenkins, and Docker
Helped with manual and automated testing.
This position was 100% remote.
Worked on the Element software that controls SolidFire storage systems; a large distributed system running on Linux, written in C++ with Boost.
Responsible for refactoring, and then maintaining, the drive management sub-system, which keeps track of drives and controls the services associated with them.
Worked on smaller features and enhancements, including improvements to fault detection, API improvements, and hardware monitoring.
Spent time on the White Box Testing Team, and helped add the Recorder sub-system for structured (JSON) logging.
Used valgrind, Coverity, and code coverage tools to improve code quality and reduce bugs.
Worked on the Interop translation portion of the then new CATIA Geometric Modeller (CGM) based product. Used C++, Python and Scheme for test generation.
Used Agile development in the Productivity and Tools group to develop the internal "TestCenter" web application. Used Java, JSP, JUnit, MySQL and Tomcat.
Maintained the "Quality Checker" (QC) component of TestCenter in C++.
Participated in a "team room" with Interop developers to develop the beta release of the CGM Writer component.
Participated in a "team room" with ACIS developers to develop of new CGM componenent.
Initially I worked in the "DBA Group", developing a web interface for creating, verifying, and managing Unique Identifier (UID) labels.
Took over development of the internal DBA website.
Created a C++ application for hand-held bar code scanners to communicate with existing inventory management system.
Volunteered for, and eventually moved to, a "Systems" development position, writing Jovial and x86 assembly language for the Automated Remote Tracking Station Software (ARTS).
Assisted with maintenance and deployment of ARTS at customer sites.
Maintained 1.5 million lines of C++ code using DCE RPC, Oracle 10g, and Solaris for the server portion of the CarlX library management system.
Used Ruby to automate testing and bug reproduction.
Refactored code to improve readability and efficiency.
Developed call routing applications for Verizon's Next Generation Service Network (NGSN).
Performed QA on applications built by other developers.
Performed troubleshooting and corrected trouble tickets.

div.div: University of Colorado At Colorado Springs

div.p: Received Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with minor in Economics

In my free time I work on a number of open source projects which are available on GitHub and SourceHut. Most are small personal projects, but I've also made many contributions to other projects, including st-json, a popular Common Lisp JSON library, and OpenGEE, the open source version of Google Earth Enterprise.
